ENGINEERING TECHNICIAN

SUMMARY

A challenging position in a Manufacturing, Engineering, or Research & Development environment where my overall technical background, along with my leadership and decision making capabilities will be combined to contribute to company goals, enlargement, & productivity.
Highlights
Excellent communication techniques Lean principles knowledge
Microsoft Excel & Word Engineering operational functions
Manufacturing systems integration
Assembly drawing Design instruction creation

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Mastered engineering software programs, including Labview and ERP systems such as Microsoft AX Dynamics Trained new and current employees for both operating procedures and manufacturing disciplines Used operational knowledge of systems, parts and components to solve problems that arose during assembly.
Personally managed production activities to guarantee 90 % of orders were shipped on-time.
Contributed to an increase in productivity through improvements in operations, quality, safety and administration.
Promoted to Production Supervisor within 8 years of employment.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Maintenance Technician I

Location: Harrisonville, MO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
A collective energy and ambition. A place where you can make a real difference.

We’re a company that genuinely cares about our people, our products, our consumers and the environment.

Our unique, informal culture champions courage, determination and collaboration. Knowing we have an open and supportive team means each of us has the freedom to take responsibility and ownership. We have a shared passion to work hard, innovate and push boundaries.

United by the belief that when we strive for growth, anything is possible. While we might not be the largest company in our industry, we believe we can have the biggest impact because: Together We Have the Power to Win.

Summary

Under supervision, performs mechanical repairs, basic electrical troubleshooting, and preventative maintenance on all Packaging Lines equipment and general facility when needed.

Principal Duties/Responsibilities

Performs entry to mid-level repairs to packaging lines during production. This could include but is not limited to troubleshooting, machine repairs, machine adjustments and fine tuning.May be required to setup and operate simple machining operations including but not limited to: drill press, grinder, lathe and other metal working tools to make and repair parts.May perform basic welding tasks.Performs Preventative Maintenance or Work Order support as scheduled. Coordinates assigned work with needs of the plant and labor availabilityIdentifies needed parts, supplies, and repair items.Assures compliance with 5S, housekeeping standards and CI activities.Works and trains on all maintenance related activities – pairs with other MT’s to gain knowledge and experience on all facets of production extending beyond packaging lines into the processing and support areas.Uses computer to update CMMS.Provides support and back up to other members of the department as needed by leadershipCompletes technical self-study programs for career development.Regular and predictable attendance is required.Follows all safety related policies, participates in required safety training, always remains observant and aware.

Knowledge Skills, Abilities

Good oral and written communication skills, organizational and time management skillsMechanical aptitudeKnowledge of industrial controls and pneumaticsThree phase electrical knowledge required: PLC knowledge desiredMachine tool experienceAbility to effectively interact with employees at all levels of the organizationAbility to work for long periods of time, under pressure to produce resultsAbility to make decisions and demonstrate ambiguity

Education And Experience

High school diploma and 1+ years proven maintenance experience working within a related manufacturing environmentThree phase electrical knowledge required with a demonstrated understanding of industrial controls and pneumaticsAllen-Bradley PLC & Hydraulic experience desired.Excellent verbal and written communication skills, strong attention desired

#piq

Church & Dwight is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

For more information on our company, our brands and our culture visit us at http://www.churchdwight.com/

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
